cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles WSW of Negril, Jamaica and 130 miles SE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the northwestern Caribbean, expected to enter the central Gulf of Mexico Saturday and curl north-northwest toward the northern Gulf Coast (LA–MS area)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast (near the mouth of the Mississippi River–Grand Isle area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches yet – guidance indicates they may be issued for the northern Gulf Coast later tonight or Friday
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. coast as of Advisory #2
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas eastward to the western Florida Panhandle, including Louisiana and Mississippi coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible by Sunday morning with a 42% cumulative chance; 11% chance of 50-kt (58+ mph) winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance signals a storm-surge threat exceeding 3 ft along the Mississippi coast, including Pascagoula, especially if the center comes ashore just west of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–8 inches with locally higher totals as outer rain-bands reach the coast Sunday into Monday, creating flash-flood risk and operational slow-downs.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain-bands and dangerous rip-currents ahead of landfall.
